description: The underlying cause of the compliance issues with the Windows Update process appears to stem from a series of error codes indicating potential access or configuration errors within the Windows Update service. Specifically, error code 0x8024401c may suggest network communication issues which inhibit the device from reaching update servers, while codes like 0x8024002d and 0x8007000d hint at problems with update completeness or installation integrity. Error code 0x80073701 further suggests that components necessary for the functioning of the Windows Update service may be corrupted or missing. Troubleshooting steps involving stopping and starting the Windows Update service, renaming the SoftwareDistribution folder, and running various health restoration commands (DISM and SFC) are indicative of issues stemming from misconfigurations or transient states that prevent proper update installation. These factors cumulatively result in non-compliance for devices on the Windows 10 environment requiring immediate attention to restore functionality and compliance with the latest update packages.
